content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
												8/10 It's a great game for people who like challenges and don't mind being social in a video game and can tolerate easy grinding. General Census  I like it, it has this cute unique charm that you don't often see in free to play's. The gameplay has very much depth on comparable terms to when ragnarok was popular before transitioning to 3D. For somebody who has watched the show on both seasons, I can say this is very faithful to the wakfu IP, especially if you like old video game references and culture.It is a very artsy game for something than runs on java and is sprite based. Gameplay The game itself is very hardcore in terms of rpg's where you need to number crunches and research on having the ideal build for characters. The gameplay is more forgiving in a sense compared to the old days where everything was un-killable without organized efforts. It is sandbox but it has some sense of direction, every so often you will get a quest giving you an idea of what you should be doing at this point. However the professions in the game and the drops give it a very strong grindy feeling, but it doesn't hurt so much because of how easy it is too grind. They give you several options and ways on how to level professions so you don't get bored or annoyed instantly. It's very easy instead of being this long gradual process, not to mention how fast you can level up. In each battle they give these conditions in the upper left which are rule sets, and if follow them no matter how confusing they can be you will get some insane bonuses. Me and a buddy have been playing this since Friday, and we reached the 30's bracket with just 6 hours of game time each day in-between this game and dark souls. And we came from games like WoW and Guild wars where everything was boring and repetitive. These rules are unique challenges and make everything more challenging because we are purposely putting handicaps on ourselves to get the best rewards. And the xp and drop rates are astonishing if you follow through, I used to beta test this game back in 2011 before they came to steam and I dropped it because of how much of a chore everything in the game was.They have these little Gatcha machines outside of dungeons and depending on your performance in them you get these tokens to use on the machines so if you trying to build a set, you just go to this little machine and use the tokens you earned to finish the set. Ups Ankama did some really good revamps and permeantly removed that paywall, everything is there for free to play and the gap between people who get boosters are very little because it just a time saver. There are some annoying options like not being able to deposit money or items in an account bank and have it spread across all characters, and having limited bag spaces;  But is solved if you just make bags or buy them off the market boards. This may be one of the first games I played where they made the environment an integral part of the game because when you cut down trees, harvest plants, or kill mobs. These things don't respawn. You have to do your part and befriend nature by collecting seeds, planting trees, and breeding monsters so you can the players around you have access. You get rewards and points by helping the environment and give your character a reputation on how helpful you are to the people around you.Everyone is rewarded for not being selfish and increasing this collaboration between people.The last part Im going to cover is the politics system and how it affects people who join nations. The people in seats of power are given the reasonability of making sure everyone in their territories is looked after. They spend their cash and collect taxes to buy bonuses which apply to everyone in their nation and their lands by having increased drop rates, more natural resources available to use, and giving access to dungeons that are not normally open for everyone. They also organize the pvp structure for the lands and against other nations. They pass laws protecting the environment and reward those who plant and expand dwindling resources. And give people titles for those who go out of their way to give security to the people that serve their realm. Everyone has a part to play to guarding lands against thieves and invaders, to distributing crafting materials and giving to the less fortunate or under leveled.  Downs The game is confusing at times and does not always explain what you need to do, I had to use the wakfu encyclopedia from time to time to figure out where stuff is, what drops what, and how to get things. It is also very weird on how sensitive things are for spells, victory conditions, quest conditions, and crafting conditions. There was an instance where I had to capture and tame a wild giant turkey, and was given 3 books which actually do nothing for me in terms on capturing it. They gave me a book on how to eat these things when I am supposed to capture one and use it as a mount, so I do not know why they would tell me how to eat my mount. I have to talk to a guy inside the pen and had to make sense of his explanation. One of the problems I have with the game is that I don't want to sit and read a bunch of paragraphs, and by not doing so I am punished by not giving me something intuitive. I constantly need to read stuff otherwise I won't know what Im doing and I don't play video games to read things, I don't mind cut scenes and people telling stories but its kind of hard to enjoy the game if I am constantly reading everything. I won't give themfor not narrating anything but it would be a nice change of pace if they gave small tutorials with a over voice explanation so youre not constantly consulting manuals or googling.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 24, 2014
												If you like rpg's,mmo's or strategy games you will love this title. This game is soo good, while I haven't played too much Dofus, I am 18 hours into the game and I can say it might be as good as Dofus. + Hilarious dialogue and character names ( Also you can see animals make out )+ You are free to do whathever you like. Whenever you grind and feel like you are getting bored, there is a lot of things that will make the boredom go away, like doing dungeons,crafting,harvesting,exploring,pvp,guild wars and much more.+Quest's are always fresh and dont feel like your average MMO where you need to either collect this and this from an enemy or killing this and this number of enemies. Usually the only collecting thing would be harveting materials , and from killing monsters, its only optional because they will give you only a little bit more exp from eco quests or like i call them "field quests"+Beautiful art design , and just exploring through the scenery feels relaxing.+Great skills that have multiple uses,and skill resets if you are not comfterable with your char.+You can choose from a wide selection of  unique characters. Even the archer is so unique.+You can put items on sale while offline and you can fast travel + Ton of archivementsNow for the bad things-Game might get grindy at times-Discarding items is a pain in the something to do-You can't sell at merchants , instead you have to sell your items to players, or discard them.-You need to put a lot of time into it if you want to get to the fun stuff-You cant move with keys, mouse only. And no camera movement besides zoom in and zoom out.-Glitches. You have them.-WHEN CAN WE WATCH THE ENGLISH ANIME ?-With friends, this is a bit easy. (But still ton more fun)Final reviewIf you put time into it, its a amazingly unique game. If you wanna get through it fast, its gonna get boring really fast.7.5/10 Recommend it to anybody who loves things like fire emblem or final fantasy tactics.

content:
Posted: September 18, 2014
												Confusing at first but highly addictive later Wakfu stays a classic must play for all tacticalturn-based RPGS fans and it in my honest opinion is a true succesor to the genre of TTB RPGs. Just Imagine Disagea and FF Tactics with strong MMO and semi-sandbox elements where you (the player) is responsible for ecosystem/politics/economy/ecology and more. The only down side is the games extreme grindines from time to time and highly group/raid based gameplay, meaning that soloing content is a lot harder than do it with a group, cause there is no downside in having a larger group.Final personal score - 8.5/10

It does little to hold your attention as I played it I found very little enjoyment in the combat system as I was thrown from boring quest to boring quest. Sounds simple but in reality all the player finds themself doing is running back and forth from granish barrel to conveyor belt hoping that the next larva is the correct color and trying to keep other larva from escaping.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 21, 2014
												Wakfu is a turned based MMORPG, that has interesting graphics, music, so on and so forth with things that've already been touched on. Lemme tell you about the part of it that really makes ME excited. Wakfu really tried to build a world that was entirely dependent on the people who play it. So, right off the bat? There are zero NPCs, aside from the occasional quest giver. That means if you're looking to sell your you better start up a stand. There's also an Ecology system that effects monsters and gathering nodes (trees, plants, ore, etc.) wherein, if you kill too much, or take too much, it'll actually GO AWAY. It's up to the player to repopulate these areas by planting things, breeding animals and generally working with the "Wakfu" of any particular area. Some other notable parts are as follow: Player elected governors, citizen points that can effect how the world treats you (Wanna be a , be an outlaw and go to jail? Hell yeah you do.), instant player housing (Haven bag) that... also works as your store, a place to decorate things, a place to put gathering nodes and so on. There's also huge maps, the ability to spec into every kind of profession, interesting character classes that have little to no over lap as far as utility... I mean, come on!I'll admit I'm pretty stoked about this game. However, it is definitely not a game for everyone. The combat can be pretty off putting, and it's generally not as fun of an experience if you go at it alone. But, if you're the type of person that really likes to see a game take some amazing steps for MMOs, you might wanna give this a shot.

content:
Posted: January 10, 2016
												A few key things to know about this game.1.) You will do a LOT of grinding.2.) The end game dungeon currently requires you to pay to even ACCESS. (No sub means the highest level area is locked out for you.3.) If you pay money you get to field more heroes/sidekicks allowing subs to monopolize more turns per fight4.) PvP is dominated by people who have sunk hundreds, if not thousands of hours into the game, even with subscriptions. If you plan on doing any serious pvp, it won't be until your AT LEAST 1,000 hours into the game. Until then be prepared for a lot of repetition. If one of these points don't turn you off then you might want to check the game out. Mechanically it isn't bad and the community, for the most part are a cool bunch of people. That said, around 120-140 prepare to spend hundreds of hours running the same 1-2 dungeons fighting the same group of mobs over and over again. Unless you can join a guild to find people who will help pass the repetitive nature of the game it will eventually get to you.NOT FOR LONE WOLF PLAY - PERIOD

content:
Posted: January 17, 2015
												PROS:Best ever game environment.  Beautiful art and style. Extensive crafting system. PVP option. Dungeons are unique and mob's are difficult to master-  they all have different abilities. Gameplay grind and difficulty creates a relatively mature player base. Can play for free if you can stand the grind punishment.CONS:Gear acquisition until you have a maxed out character is very punishing! If you're used to Warcraft dungeons, where you can get all the gear you need that matches your level running  dungeons, you're going to be frustrated. Dungeons AT YOUR LEVEL, are DIFFICULT for a group, YOUR LEVEL. So you're basically left with hoping you have some maxed level freinds to run you through, over and over. Which by that time, you've leveled past the gear you were after in the first place. The system really makes no sense.Getting groups at levels other than high levels is hard. Most players are maxed and have no incentive to help you with low level dungeons. They need to introduce player scaling and rewards so high level players are compelled to play low level dungeons.BIGGEST CON:  THE GRIND.It's the most punishing grind I've ever experienced- even if you purchase booster packs for 3x the XP. Now I only get to play an hour or two here and there and on weekends, but I've been playing about a year and my highest toon is 115 out of 165. People get around this by being "power leveled" by high level players- which is about as fun as teasing a cat with string... You're just there for idle chit chat while they blow mobs down- for hours....SUMMARY:One of my favorite games ever due to art, sounds, playstyle and difficulty. But it has serious flaws with helping and keeping new players interested (grind and grouping). Best summarized as an MMO Chess Game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 4, 2014
												Good:Combat is fun, especially with friendsThe world is very open allowing for exploration and training your skills well beyond your level (like mining and carpentry)All currency and item value is created and determined by the players, creating a unique market systemYou can wage war on other nations with more than just pvp, you can destroy their resources as wellBeing a bandit is actually helpful to other players, because they gain citizenship points for correcting your eco-terrorismBad:No one usually wages war. Most of the time everyone is friendsThere are no incentives to become a bandit other than for the hell of itGame suffers from imbalanced resources (using three logs to get one plank, and using 17 planks to make a box)experiencing minor, but consistent lag. Game seems to hickup ever couple minutes, or when pulling up the map/gathering resourcesSometimes creatures are labeled as Busy but arent doing anything, so you cant get rid of them.Overall, a very good game and most issues I have with it can be solved if players start trying to kill eachother in-game.

content:

												Today was my best day in life.I play this game in alpha,beta and official.This game had one big minus....P2P!!! But today I was looking at games in steam and I just see Wakfu.I think:"well I will download it and see if it's still P2P or not".I nearly cried when I find it's f2p.In fact you can buy things for money but you musn't which is amazing,because this game was like 3 Years P2P...I have no words for this.GJ Amakna!!!Pros:+Graphics+Combat System+Many classes+Many proffesions+Guilds+Many sides of conflicts(brakmar-devils,bonta-angels,amakna-mercenaries,suia-?)+F2P!!!!!+You can reset once per months all stats which is amazing because if you make mistake,or you can don't like your build you can change it one per month.+Purchased items not affect that much and you can win with people who buy items.So it's not P2W.+Open world.You can go everywhere!!!! When it was official you had restricted zone!!! This is awesome!!!Cons:-There is nothing like site with builds,which means you must experiment on your build or ask experienced player about it.-Fell little empty and unsocial because you see people and you walk around and when you go somewhere there is little chance you will see again same person.I back to this game when I started play it nearly 3 years ago and I will stay like 16 hours per day on it.infinity/10

content:
Posted: March 26, 2016
												Wakfu, I kind of recommend the game, the free build allows you to make the character any way you want, beside may not have skills for that kind of gameplay.The world in the game is big, and there are quests and events that pop up randomly that gives you experience, you can also help the world be populated with monsters and flora, or even destroy it, depending on what you do, you can even gain a few good points to your nation.There is also the crafting system on the game, where you can create items and weapons that may be usefull for you, and the better, you can learn all kinds of crafting at the same time, so no cap of what you can specialize on.The only cons I found on the game are:Look's like attacking with the player equipped weapon is weaker than using skills on the enemy, even more because weapon attack can only be used once per turn, but skills, depending on them, can be used twice or more in a turn, causing higher dps.The faction war system is the most vile system I've ever saw in a game, beside it seems like not having much impact on the game world, it impossibilitates you of visiting other towns, because if you cross the frontier, you are screwed.You can easily get confused when doing quests, even more because some of them are not very clear of where is the objective, so you may end up having to look on the web where is the quest objective.Beside those cons, the game is fun, but not really my type of game, even more because playing alone may make you get tired of it very quickly.

content:
Posted: April 19, 2016
												This is one of the best MMORPGs I've ever played. The textures may not look so good if you play games for what they look like, but they've got theyr beauty. Also every single thing in this game is amazingly complex, like the ecosystem or the jobs. Damn, it even has political stuff in it if that's what you're into. Also the classes are sooooooooo varied, each with it's own huge range of unique spells that provides aload of combos and stuff. One more thing: the game is MASSIVE, it has tons of areas to explore and a lot of dungeons, items, jobs, quests, anything... The bad stuff? Well, if you play alone it kinda gets boring, but it's a good thing that Wakfu has this amazing comunity, everyone is so friendly and helpful and stuff, no trolls, nor scammers, so you'll make friends real fast and you'll have for sure someone to play with. In the end: great game, also free so it won't hurt to try.

												I have played this game since my Dofus days. It is a very great game and the business model that they use is amazing. This game is very F2P friendly! It will take over your life and caress you and take you to a magical place. 10/10 will keep banging daily.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
												Wakfu is a great 2D mmorpg. Its one of a kind and none like it and you cant go wrong with trying it out.Its a deep game with a steep lvlcap over 160. Many classes to play and one of a kind that do not share skills or even textures.Wakfu has a massive land to roam and has many many crafting jobs. Hell you can even re populate the world with monsters.Do not go by what all the bad Steam reviews say... Most of them just got mad they updated the class they had and made it much harder to play. The support maybe bad or not but most mmos are worst. As for the bugs, all AAA games mmos or not on consoles and pc have more bugs then this so dont let the thumbs down run you off.

												Okay, i will make it short.I don't get it, i dont know what i have to do in this game at all. content:
Posted: January 31, 2016
												one day i decided to start working on my mining skills because i wanted to craft something.you can probably tell by the fact that i didnt say what it was i wanted to craft that i have forgotten what it was.so anyways i started mining the most basic iron, and because i figured even non-miner guys can easily get their hands on it by mining it themselves or from people who sell it for cheap, so i just dumped them in the kama minting machine.slowly, i got to the more high-level ores, and salt.around that level i decided the ores were worth more than iron at least, and i couldnt put coal and salt into the minting machine(i dont think so anyway), so i sold them for about 20 kamas apeice.soon i noticed something: salt sold EXTREMELY well, i always logged in every morning to find all the salt i put up for sale sold out, so i started to prioritize mining salt as well as continueing to grind out mining levels for more advanced ores that could potentially have higher demand and sell for more.but nothing, and i mean NOTHING, not even refined salt, sold better than the base salt ore.then one day i noticed i was logging in every morning and spending upwards of 2 hours just going around the same few spots mining salt and minting kamas.11/10 would restart salt-mining empire when i regain the taste for MMOs

Then the "Report a Problem" link locked up the game.I can't comment on the quality of the game, because I can't play it. It seems like Wakfu needed to be baked a while longer before release.

content:
Posted: May 18, 2016
												I'd like to start saying my hours played isnt very accurate. I played via Wakfu launcher for much more than i did here.This game is a remake of a popular game known as Final Fantasy Tactics. a Square grid based, turn based tactical game.There are some great features of the game but most are overshadowed with extreme lacklustre support and game management. Ranging from hacks and exploits never being dealt with causing the entire auction house(market) to flood kamas into the game nulifying the years spent aquiring them. Top end-endgame gear being duplicated and flooding the system making them about as expensive as a level 20 set.Even dealing with the PKing system which is an absolute joke if you run into a kiddie that has nothing better to do then camp decent leveling zones ( such as A.W) and kill you for no reason hours on end. (Which wasnt really a problem  after a while because i just Ddos'd him anytime i needed to enter the zone again so my friends and I could atleast play the game hassle free.) Then there is the subscription issue. As a player that has been with Wakfu and Dofus for many years now and owns all DLC and content. My subscription has finally ran out and I am no longer able to enter most end-game zones to further progress my character. So I provided Wakfu with money to assist with producing new content for them to release the content and then make me pay again to play on it... Seems a bit stupid from a consumers prospective. My friends and I have now actually quit Wakfu due to extreme neglect from Management and lack of content advancements over the years.While i DO recommend this game for a new users for a few hours to pass some time. I do not however advise you to ever pay them for their lack of service and progress and just quit once it gets a little boring after a hour or two.PS. There is a reason the "Bug and Issues" forum is bigger than the "General Disucssions" forum..

number of helpful: 3 of 8 people (38%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 26, 2015
												Wakfu. The name alone makes people cringe like, you don't even want to go there.In the beginning there was Dofus, and I'd be lying if I said all was well.Dofus was the first of its kind, back when Steam actually made games and we were all little younglings playing 'Gunz: The duel'. Dofus was an interesting beast because unlike conventional play to win games at the time, Dofus was an over glorified demo of an MMO back when other MMO's thought they could actually stand up to the likes of Everquest and World of Warcraft.As time went on, many of us old guard who rememered the awful, oppressive treatment at the hands of Anakama had moved on and seemingly so had a large enough portion of the playerbase that a sequel was in order!A strange move indeed, making a sequel only a few years after your base product had launched. Wakfu of course is that sequel. Well it was announed years before it arrived and that signalled only the beginning of its issues. Not as late as Duke Nukem Forever but late enough to miss its own funeral because Wakfu is effectively dead.I say effectively because the servers seem to still be online, probabaly with the funding from the first game and piggy backing on those servers too no doubt.Dofus became a franchaise even having its own cartoon series over in France and its nice that we have a game filling this cutesy on the surface but brutally difficult when you play niche, but Wakfu is an MMO and with so few people around to play with, it just falls apart.But lets go back in time! What about when there WERE people to play with? Dofus was still a better game! Its like they took out all the things in Dofus that demanded teamwork and made Wakfu a 1 player game with online connectivity.Some people may like that idea but remember that this game was born from an MMO; it is akin to World of Warcraft having a World of Warcraft 2, still set in Azeroth only now its a one player twin stick shooter. It might be good on its own merits but we can't ignore the dramatic shift and we know the old crowd, the ones most likely to even want a sequal are going to feel very alienated.That is Wakfu. Welcome to Wakfu.Now all that aside is the game even good? Well the animations are fantastic, no really they are a joy to look at! The music...Well it exists. Yeah no one track really adds much which is a shame. The graphics are once again top notch like the animation and looking at the world around you isn't breath-taking like in Dark Souls or anything like that but they look great. Real dediction went into every art asset.Wakfus biggest failings are not even its own fault. Communities grow and wain as new products come out to tempt the crowds. Anakama are terrible at customer support but that is more of an 'outside of the game' issue. The music might lack pepper but that is very minor indeed. Really I don't recommend Wakfu but only for 1 reason and that reason is that its old! I don't mean old games suck, not in the least but what I mean is the community is effectively gone, its like Guildwars, which is a fantastic game, but going into Lions arch and having no one to play with, well it is the death kneel for an "MMO" and while people are playing Wakfu, the vast community has long since moved on and when I played I found barely anyone to interact with, even my screenshots were barren of life when I took them.What a shame.If you and enough of your friends can populate the game, you may have fun. If however you are looking to play this game in order to make new friends then move on, their is nothing to see here.Join Grumpy reviews for all your gaming needshttp://steamcommunity.com/groups/grumpyreviews

content:
Posted: January 16, 2015
												Years ago, this game was roughly 5% F2P. You could hardly do anything. It was fun but so incredibly limited. Now that it's ~95% F2P, you can do pretty much everything. So far, the only thing I've seen in-game that costs real money is an account-share vault that allows you to store items to be used by all characters on your account. A huge improvement from what I saw so long ago.The fighting style is very similar to Final Fantasy Tactics, one of my favorite games of all time. Play with friends or else you'll feel lost in this big, confusing world. You can solo but it's a lot easier with friends and the game seems to lean heavily on party play.I'd rate this game a 9/10 with a half point deduction because of repeatition (which is in pretty much every RPG) and another half point deduction because it's not as fun to solo. I highly recommend you play with friends.

Posted: May 23, 2016
												Love the show, don't love the game.Improvements I think that are worth my time:*Making dungeons playable with a single character*Balancing outside mobs      (EVEN in the STARTING AREA a level 6 and level 3 are easier to kill than a level 3 and level 5 cause the level 5 can spam heals and the level 3's AI tells it that if it gets hit run on a tile that heals every enemy, for a noob and even a returning player when your trying to do the early level grind it will kill you if you are not careful and they are the starting area mobs, like really?)*Don't give stat point control to your player classes        (YOUR NOT DARK SOULS, you have a level cap and rng on good equipment making players rethink the points they spend constantly)*Don't have a spell level up system if you keep having to fix it         (After playing tons of other mmorpgs, seeing a xp grind system slapped onto spells(skills) makes the game punishing when after hours of grinding you find out that one spell in your build becomes pointless and should be switched out.)*Lower the drop rate on emotes or any cosmetic items        (If I can't play the guitar in battle then it does NOT need to instill the faith I have of the sheer chance of a werewolf trying to dry hump my leg before it ever thinks about droping.)*Cut all the grinding for xp in half         (Oh I don't mean like get rid of the xp booster, keep those and make them give even more xp than before! I understand you got to make a living but people who can't invest in alternate characters without a booster makes them jump ship to another game.)*Fix your REPORT FEATURE         (I think they still haven't fixed the bug that makes your computer freeze the screen almost every 5 seconds of character movement.)Til then enjoy having the Nox server look like a ghost town. Really is looking more empty everyday I get back on.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2014
												While the game has many good aspects, it turns into just farming very fast. The gathering system reminds of RuneScape skilling system but worse (is that even possible?). Farm for 2 hours to get a few levels in woodcutting and then have a ton of wood with nothing to really use it for. The crafting system is overally complex for the gear it provides and there is a lack of any game or story progression. Whats the purpose of playing? This is ultimately more of a Farming Simulator than the actual Farming Simulator game. While there is a multitude of unique classes, every character in the same class is ultimately the same. A large lack of skill customization. All it offers is slight stat customization which isn't very great either. It pretty much asks you if you want a minor boost in hp, defense or attack but makes it more complex than calculus with more stats than is necessary. From what I experienced in the dungeons, there are no intensely strategic boss fights and maybe there are some after you farm for hours upon hours in boredom, its really not worth it to find out. After level 18 the story drops off no where to be find, and there is seriously only like 10 quest givers from levels 18-60 that give out daily repeatable quests of go collect 10 of these junk items for me.It's not worth the time it takes to play it even if it is free.

content:
Posted: March 12, 2016
												I gave this game a fair chance--I truly did. It has its own unique charm and somewhat unique gameplay elements. There are many job classes--and I do mean many with tons of specializations you can consider by spending your precious skill points in one skill tree or another. You can even bash the tarnation out of other players via pvp at any time in the open world environment--even from the start of the game (once past the tutorial area).However, there are so many other mmorpgs out there that this one gets lost in the crowd and there are some incredibly frustrating elements to the game's structure. First off, it seems to be programmed exclusively in Flashplayer and uses a point-and-click interface to get the character to do anything. So you will be constantly using a mouse for everything. Leveling crafts, crafting gear, grinding, it gets to be so tedious with such a clunky interface after a while that I honestly just stopped with the other aspects of the game and tried focusing on leveling just to try and keep going.One of the main features of the game though is political and other players seem to constantly beg you for one thing or another--or even worse: they attack you because you belong to a different faction than them. Unfortunately, there's no way to simply stay factionless in the game either--it makes you choose one to progress past certain points and areas in the game.I honestly gave this game a go because I thought it would be something completely different--and it was: a nightmare. If you like a game with entirely too much going on then maybe this one might be for you. Otherwise you might want to skip this one. (And yes, I kept this review general on purpose without going into any spoilers--you're welcome XD)

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 27, 2016
												First ImpressionsWell i haven't played a MMORPG for a few years now. GW2 was the last, but also played in the day LOTRO, Metin2, Linage II, and a few others can't seem to remember. So after, i installed the game which didn't tell me exactly the file size of the actual game (not the starter), I started where all should start - Tutorial. And sure enough I was like WTF?!Tutorial if anything is anything but a tutorial - they obviously expect players to know how to play the game straight off the bat. What was bad is the mechanics... ie choosing a tile behind the character is sticky unless you zoom in. One has to guess what each button on the keyboard is for straight away - So understanding the hotkeys is all guess work. Even then, the setup for the hotkeys is .... defined for one way.Kind of reminds me of Final Fantasy Tactics, with a Baulder Gate Overview where you cannot rotate the screen, but a Borderlands feel of graphic design. I don't know if this is suppose to be a mixed of some cartoon or Kungfu Panda but it doesn't grab me. But appears to be another Cash Grab FreemiumsUnless you want to slog it out farming for wheat for over a few hours and then move onto the next item just so you can build something else. And the fact that I have all the stuff that I can't even sell to a NPC or buyfrom a NPC is annoying. I couldn't even work out how to setup shop for when I logout, i read forums but still no step by step instruction on how to do it.Does this game have potential - sure, any game does. But, by the time I got to level 11 I was wishing I didn't even bother with this. Maybe someone might lend me hand/ear/nose in the right direction but really - I am not bothering. Forcast for deletion in 5 days time.

content:
Posted: September 20, 2014
												I don't have any play time Via Steam because I've been playing it for months via Ankama. This is an extremely fun game, with quite a lot to do. from dungeons to professions, challenges, quests, and its getting bigger and better every day, While the customer support at times is lacking. the game is amazing. full of comedy, and also peverse sense of humor can be found in almost everything, from the monsters drops to the equipment, some of them are just outlandish, take a look at the Tofu Rump monster drop if you don't believe me, its a literaly A hole lol.The game has a political system, with an ever changing ecology for every zone, containing plants, crops, tree's ore and mosnters. all of which are depleted / maintained through players, and naturally occuring reproduction ( you can watch some Gobball / Tofu porn while you wait for spawns :D lols ) and a weather system, while not entirely visual, its presentm and affects growth rates of plants. all in all, I would very readily reccomend this game for anyone interested in an mmorpg with tactical grid based combat.

number of helpful: 18 of 39 people (46%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 25, 2014
												This game has a lot of potential. Too bad it doesn't make any use of it.The combat is fun. It's different than what most games do, it's pretty tactical. It lasts you for about 2 days, because it gets repetitive fast. Why? Well there are a lot of classes, they are pretty different from each other, you can really find one for you. Each class has 3 branches of abilities, depending on element you will be using.While you have up to 15 active abilities you will only use about 2-3(at most) from them, since there aren't many situational skills, there are just those that do more and less damage. You don't want to mix abilities between branches, because that means less damage(best gear gives element based +%damage). Skills in the same branch usually have the same range, so you're stuck with either long range or close combat once you choose. And that's not a bad thing right? Well, no, but once again, you're stuck with using 2 skills because the others deal less DPS.It doesn't help that you kill the same enemies over and over again, because the game is so empty that finding a group for a dungeon is nearly impossible, except for the most popular dungeons, and even then it's problematic.Most people meet in starter area,which is pretty populated. After you get to your nation, you're pretty much playing single player with someone passing you by every once in an hour.At least the crafting system looks nice, after choosing to become an area of effect weapon smith I was greeted with message that I won't be able to harvest materials, and will have to buy them from lumberjacks and miners. Wish I had some kind of warning before I chose my profession, but okay, I'm fine with that, the system looks great! This means that what I make will surely have buyers, because if you're a lumberjack you won't be able to make those weapons. If you're a baker you will buy my weapons and I will buy your bread. That's awesome! Finally someone did it right.Except I still could harvest. I could chop down the trees and gather iron ore from deposits. I could learn all the professions and create anything I needed myself.Instead of having good economy based on supply and demand, they screwed it up completely. You want to be a baker? Well you better be a farmer too, because otherwise you would have to pay for the flour. It's fun for about 2 days, after that you have tried all classes, finished the Astrub(starter zone) quests 10 times, and there's no point in moving to main land, since there's no people there.That's a shame.

number of helpful: 3 of 9 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 17, 2014
												This game has a pretty unique turn based, tactical gameplay which is actually kind of fun. What makes it tactical is the fact that you might block other players view, you have a limited amount of steps you can take per turn, and stuff like that.It also has an interesting ecological system in which you can take part. To take part in it you can plant new trees, spawn new enemies, plant crops and of course harvest all this stuff, etc.BUT if you are looking for something like a "classic" MMORPG with straight questlines you might want to try another game because this game is a pure grinder. Except for the starting zone there are like no quests. All you do is to go from one group of enemies to another. While doing so, do not expect to meet any other players.All in all, I'd say that this game has a great potential because the tactial fighting system is a lot of fun but there are hardly other players except for the starter city but still there are like a 100 servers. What ruins the game for me is the lack of quests.

number of helpful: 2 of 7 people (29%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 25, 2014
												I tried, I really tried to get into this game. But here is my perspective:The game is quite nice but I do not reccomend this to brand new players. It really is not new player friendly, and the dungeons are very difficuly for new players. You need patience to play this game.It is turn based, and the combat system is unique but what made me (as a new player) leave this behind were:Dungeons that are puzzle based, really give you zero hints on how to beat it. You are forced to use google on this and you cannot leave a battle unless you quit the game. Other tactical based mmos allow an "escape" feature if the battle is too tough or you need to leave, this however does not.  This right here is a red flag for me.Another feature that didn't really keep my interest is the quest system. For new players, if you log off, you have to manually try to find your quest destination as most do not give you a compass (quest tracking tracing feature).So in summary:Pros____Unique battle systemTons of classesSmall Patch and DownloadCons____Not new player friendly.Map layout can be confusing for new players.Google how to beat puzzle dungeons (new players).No hints on puzzles from in-game.Can't leave in the middle of a battle without logging out. (no escape or flee chance option).Overall: Do tons of research and look up guides if you are new to Wakfu. If you are a veteran, then jump right in.New player perspective: 3/10

												The osamodas (My favorite class) had so much nerf from the beginning :- You could capture ANY monster -> Now you can only capture about 50%- You could summon multiple (With Taming stat, you could specialize full invocation (Hard but seriously fun)) -> Nowyou it give "Bonus" to creature, and when i say bonuses, i mean +2% dmg crap like that- Now the only viable specialization is "Dragon mode", wich is basiclly your character on steroid, wich, if you play dofus, you know this classe is all about puching other ppl... Hu? What's that? Oh, its seems Iop want his class gameplay backAbout 3/4 of classes are like this.I've played sooooo many hours on dofus, got exited with wakfu release, then all my hopes were crushed one by one after each update.Yes, you have many classes.Yes, its f2p (The only advantage by paying per month is bonus like x2 exp... so its not pay2win).Yes, its turn based game mmo (Quite rare).But no, the class balance is really broken with some of them.As a veteran of ankama games, i can't recommend it.As a player perspective, i will recommend it with a little shrug.PS: Don't be fooled by the 17.2 hours, i've played about ~70 hours when it was not on steam

												I am a Foggernaut, distance-classified Stasis robot.I live inside a bag.My favorite thing is to mine iron and go on Motherfogger mode.My Motherfogger mode is extreme. number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 8, 2014
												A charming game - initially.Cash shop is more cosmetic than gameplay - except for boosters to xp and drops.Combat is a plus , its highly tactical , full of MANY skills  with a broad array of tactics to use depending on the skills you choose to develop. Many different stats affect gameplay.There are no NPC's. Players will have to barter or trade for any ingame currency. This can be a blessing or a curse depending how it is implemented in a game and how a games economy is setup. In wakfu , this is a curse.Wakfu suffers from an extraordinarily handicapped economic system. There is a central auction house however most things cost 1-20 / ea , ingame currency. If those things are even listed. It is cavernously empty most of the time. Many items run 20,000 - 20,000,000. Prices vary wildly , not because of some economic principle , but because there is a large glut of equipment left over from those whom are "Leeched" through most of the games levels to level 105 by already established guilds. If your a new players who does not wish to interact with or play marco polo trying to discover who the major guilds are - Good luck.  The player base is sharply divided between old veteran players (commanding in some instances hundreds of millions of ingame currency) , whom are largely silent and meandering new players who dont seem to understand what todo or where togo and whom appear to be largely confused.Leveling is fun ....... the first 50 times you encounter mobs.  Once you realize exactly how much grinding is entailed you begin to understand the presence of xp pots in the ingame item mall - and why new players are encouraged simply to quit the game if they cant find an active guild which they can tag along with during higher end repetitive runs. Seriously , I was told this several times.  Respec'ing your character? Is considered an act of god in this game. An occassion so special that it requires no less than 1400 items spread across 8 different mob types which must be killed to gather at a pace of about 1-3 per encounter (Not kidding). Even THIS can only be done every 30 days.  Act of god? Or act of marketing? You decide.  Oh and if your a new player - you can expect these encounters to last anywhere from 5-10 mins , EACH.   For a game as complex as wakfu is with so many different tactics to try - to have such a choke hold on simply redistributing points you earned through gameplay is rediculous in the least in my opinion. It is clearly a money grabbing effort.  Almost no information is available for many of the classes , many posts date back to 2012 - some so far as 2011 - so one is never sure whether the information you are getting is upto date or not.  The game is updated semi-frequently however , going so far as to literally change the stats on sets of armor between updates***     Have fun with that!Despite all of this?  Im still playing it. Glutton for punishment? Likely.

content:
Posted: January 20, 2015
												This game is terrible. Think of the worst aspects of The Old Republic F2P along side the grindiest bits of the original Ragnarok online and you have Wakfu.Unless you pay money you earn half as much exp and constantly lose items, that they blatently flaunt stealing from you in the exp window after combat labeled "PREMIUM REWARDS". Thats not all! Theres a P2W element in the mix too! There as sidekicks which are additional party members that you control. They give you one free one, but he has only 3 attacks and is always weaker than single mobs of the same level, meanwhile they sell a wide variety of sidekicks that have about 5 attacks along side passives and a higher stat climb and you can use multiple at the same time. Thats all along side what appears to be a level buying option in the store labeled "Class change 1-200". Thus ends the money section, onto the bad systems.The crafting system is a hilariously bad joke, requiring a ludicrious amount of materials for even low level recipes, to the point where you will out level anything you are trying to make before you can get the mats and the skill level to craft it. Also, pretty much all the crafts require you to use something you make using early mats even way back into the later levels, which means grinding low level herbs and picking cat hair ro make that leather you need off level 1 mobs at level 50.The dungeons aren't terrible, they have about 3 fights in them that rise slowly till the final boss, but the grouping mechanic doesn't work. I ed with it for a full 15 minutes before giving up. From what I can tell people put up requests to do a dungeon or quest and people can .... "register" for thier group, but nothing happens and trying to set up my own was a waste of time due to poor UI implimentation as the buttons had faces and crap on them rather than words so what they did, if anything, was unclear.There is no story. They pretend there is one but there isn't. Intro: something horrible happened and youre the hero to fix it, and thats the last I heard about it till i quit at level 30 due to boredom.The game is so buggy I'd call it broken. Alongside achievements being disabled since september according to the forum, I was given a quest thats uncompleteable due to being unable to interact with the arena tables without getting a connection error in game. Leveling up is agony since mousing over a stat to see what it does causes the display box to stutter rapidly until you find the magic pixel the game wants you to rest the mouse over so that it can display properly.This doesn't just apply to menus though, the game  itself if you are both moving and mousing over an NPC, jerking and flickering so much that you'd think it was crashing.  Then theres the broken npcs. I went into an area where EVERY SINGLE female mob was bugged and as a result so was every other enemy that was in its group. I could not harvest from them, I could not attack them and they covered an ENTIRE ISLAND, so it was effectively offline. That was one occurance, It happened 4 different times with 4 different mobs in 4 different areas and logging out and back in did not fix it, it was a server issue.Finally, the game also lags horribly. I have a 3mbps connection, yet every 10 seconds everything on screen would stop while the server struggled to keep up with what is a turn based game.There is charm in this game. The combat is interesting though bog standard for a tactical game and the art is cute, but it is so grindy and incompitantly taped together that I cannot recomend it to anyone.

number of helpful: 8 of 20 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 11, 2014
												My review will simply be about things I wish people had told me before I clicked 'install' on this:1.) THERE ARE NO VENDERS TO SELL JUNK TO. Too much junk? Throw it on the ground. Click 'Ok' on popup. Did it have a little hammer icon on it? Whoops, looks like it was needed to craft some crap somehow. No big deal, was probably 1 of 90 of the item needed.2.) GOOD LORD THERE IS A LOT OF CRAFT GRINDING. Let's say you wanted to wanted to make a 'Ham Sandwich' so you got +2% damage for 15 minutes (in a turn-based game). In WoW, you'd butcher some mobs and buy some salt and then cook over a fire pit and *BAM* 'Ham Sandwich' ... but not Wakfu. Nope. Go grind mining until you mine raw salt, make 3 raw salt into "Refined Salt' and then go out in the field and skin some mobs for meat. Hope you leveled skinning! Go farming for wheat. Make 3x wheat into flour. Draw some water. Bake the bread. Cook the Sandwich. Each of those skills, the Mining, Skinning, Farming, Baking, Cooking... are all separate skills with a METRIC TON of grind and there's a FAILURE CHANCE as you're crafting. ALL THAT FOR A SANDWICH BUFF THAT WILL BE OVER IN 1-2 COMBATS. Since there's no vendor to sell crap to once you're done, you either throw it on the AH (Governor sets a tax!) and it come down after 24 hours or you put that trash right on the ground because your bags are full.3.) SPACE FOR ALL THE MATERIALS. There's no low-end bag vendor. You get two quest bags early on, but you'll fill up soon and the "You're too full" popups always have a "Are you sure?" annoyance chaser. Nobody makes low-end bags on the Auction House, so you're left stumbling through a horrible crafting system. Often, you'll need stuff from Tailor, Tanner, AND Armor crafting lines to get an item made... and the next upgrade will need you to make 3x-10x more of those AND use dungeon boss drops. Don't forget the failure chance! Or you can spend $1USD on 9-slot bags or $3-$10 on bank slots.This game could easily be the MMO equivalent of a 'F-ville' game. You can walk anywhere without being attacked and just grind material collection. This could honestly be the best Mother & Son, Farming & Killing crossover game of all time... but that'd be such a rare niche thing to hit. If this was Steam Market-able, then you could play the game with all sorts of loot and then sell it or trade it on the market once you'd decided it was way to grinding and directionless... but you can't. Meanwhile, Ankama totally wants you to spend $10 on character pimping, $10 on functional stuff, and then $6 every 30 days on a 'booster pack' for XP boost and access to subscriber content.The last thing I can say is about the class I played. Sram. I HATED the character design of the Sram, but it did what I wanted. I hate, Hate, HATE the character design. It's a stupid sugar skull design tattoo'ed on a WoW troll, complete with troll witch-doctor hat. But you may think "Well, weren't there cosmetic outfits or at least armor for characters?" Well yes. But all the other characters have on short-shorts or just panties, so 99% of the outfits are designed to leave the legs bare. The stupid Sram is in a bone-print onesie, which bleeds through every outfit but one. And there's no reason given! None! There's no "Oh, they have to wear this crap or their souls won't go to Sramville!" ... it's just "We didn't make pant-armor in the game so nothing ever covers that up?"

number of helpful: 4 of 12 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 20, 2014
												The game was ok when it first came out I've sunk hundreds of hours into it but with each new patch comes new bugs and suprisingly enough the issues i had when i first started playing are still around today such as immense lag. The delay in my text appearing on screen is almost 5 minutes long you dont want to know what its like in a battle.I don't have these issues in any other games other then wakfu even their prior game Dofus which has been around for 10 years isnt laggy. How this got on Steam i will never know.They keep bringing out more new cool things with each update but never actually work on the current issues not to mention their customer service is absolutley shocking. Countless threads have been made in the forum regarding issues with the game and they have gone unheard or simply ignored for YEARS! There is an issue that every person has ingame where they will start to freeze up at around the 3 hour mark of playing if not sooner. But as ankama doesnt bother fixing this long time running issue the players see it as a normal thing and actually accept that they have to restart their client every hour or two just to keep playing.. What if your in a high level dungeon and all of a sudden start experiencing these freezes. I know for a fact my guildmates have become frustrated to the point where they quit as have I.I came back to check it out as I saw it was on Steam but I am very dissapointed.The game has picked up in popularity due to its Steam release but alas I still think its not worth the time invested, As like me you will get a high(ish) level character invest money in the game and then it slaps you in the face and becomes unplayable.Also purchase Ogrines at your own risk there are multiple reports of people not recieving their Paid for Currency and as Ankama take so long to reply you may be waiting over a week to hear back.. I literally yesterday recieved a response to a ticket I posted LAST YEAR!

number of helpful: 17 of 39 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 23, 2014
												I have played this game since close beta, about 2 years ago maybe?, then open beta, and then pretty much for a year.As some reviews say, and they are right, the worst enemy of the game is Ankama itself. It changes core features of the game with patches, and patches are common; it changes classes, changes skills, items, most of the times it makes them all obsolete.I remember playing a sacrier back then when the game got "full", i spent months building him tank, a lot of months and time, the GRIND... What happened next? Ankama decided to nerf every skill of the Earth Sacrier... ok, so i can live with that... what happened next? There was ONLY ONE BOSS that COULD USE an Earth Sacrier that was build IN ONLY ONE WAY... so i was obsolete/useless. Pretty much 8 months wasted.I dont even want to start with the loot.The Game Art its beautiful, lovely, i really like it. The gameplay, is good, sometimes the fights are intense. Some fights can change with just a blink, you may thought you already won the fight, but then something happens, like a critical, and it changes everything. It can improve drastically, it can learn from really good RPGs like Final Fantasy Tactics, but overall its ok.Classes balances where ok back then, but as i said, Ankama HATES this game and its players.I encourage you to try the game because it has A LOT of potential, and hope someday Ankama dies, Square Enix dies, and a good developer gets its hand on it. Sorry i dont want to offend anyone from those companys.

												I played this game when it was on the open beta.The game was fun, addicting and crowded.Now its left with hacks, bots, scammers and a few dedicated players who somewhat manage to go through the game remake which in my opinion, was the coup de grace on this game.The game has already very few skills and combos, like 3 elements for each class, 4 skills for each element and a class passive related skills, in a total of 16 skills, from lvl 1 to 200, the same over and over again.But now, its like 8 skills, including the passives.Plus, since its release, there was no new classes added, barely a new contect now and then, must of the stuff are cash content, and prepare your mind to the grindfest. GL with that, i ain't playing this crap again.

number of helpful: 0 of 4 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 6, 2014
												Do not bother with this piece of trash. I know this comes off as incredibly negative review but I was trying to curb my frustration with this game for the simple reason that I REALLY wanted to like this game. The genre is SO rare to find a good version of it that isn't plagued by utter stupidity.The BIGGEST and most SACRELIGIOUS issue with this game is the TIMER. Don't EVER make a tactics game with a timer. There's NEVER a reason to do this and it just rushes things.Now ... this wouldn't have been such a massive issue if it wasn't for the fact that everything is SO hard to understand. The translations aren't HORRIBLE, but the descriptions are rather ... vague and subpar. They make figuring out how abilities work and effect function more trial and error than actual reading and understanding. Which is made harder by a short turn timer.Then you have an opening tutorial that does nothing to grease new players into the game. This will be a grindy game, from beginning to end. And in all the weirdest ways. Grinds in the typical ways of course too, but weird ways like forcing yourself to learn a new game that fights against you because the genre is so promising and the like.It's very painful to see such a pretty game turn me away because of simple, outright, horrible execution. I sometimes wonder after playing a game like this .... Do these people even play their own game?

number of helpful: 0 of 4 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 27, 2014
												Wakfu is a turn-based MMORPG, with a great variety of characters and builds, and a heavy dose of grinding.I found the first hour enjoyable, but the tutorial leaves a lot to the imagination, and there is a steep learning curve when entering the actual game.My main problem with the game is the combat system. In combat, there is a timer for every action, and when you're a new player, obviously you want to read what all your spells do and what your enemies are weak against, read passive buffs/de-buffs, etc. But the timer is way too short to do any of that, and seeing as you have enough action points to complete multiple attacks/spells in a go, it is a rush to complete your turn.Secondly, the combat area is split into tiles/squares, each one accounting for 1 movement/range. Now, when casting a spell or attacking an enemy, you have to ensure that you have clear line of sight to the target, and that they are within range - which means, inside of the minimum and maximum range.When you move your character, as there are often so many obstacles on the map, it is really hard to tell whether you will be able to attack the enemy with a spell, from the tile you are moving to. This means, if you are playing a spellcaster (and all characters have spells), you may sometimes waste a whole turn just trying to stand in a position where the enemy is in range.There is also no basic 'attack'. You can't just hit someone. Your basic attack is determined by the weapon you are holding, and the weapon will have a predetermined attack range and attack area. For example, in the tutorial you receive an axe, this weapon attacks three squares around your character in a big sweeping motion, and if you have an ally nearby, the ally will take damage from the swing.Basically, the combat is too complicated to have a timer, the tile system seems quite broken, and the information needed to make the learning curve less steep, is not very accessible. The tutorial itself was of no help when coming to the actual game.

Posted: March 29, 2015
												It's REALLY good. There's several classes to choose from, pets, sidekicks, mounts, different armours, taunts, weapons and a large level tree, crafting options and tons and tons of professions. Quests are varied and in depth, there's a voting system on who's in charge, different areas, dungeons and so on. You can even team up with other players for better item drops and more xp. When animals and plants are killed/harvested, you need to replant them, teaching the player how to look after and keep the ecosystem in check. Only problem is, achivements are bugged, and dont unlock. The characters also look cute. ^w^

content:
Posted: October 6, 2014
												Alright, I haven't invested too much time into Wakfu thus far and I can't say I want to eithier. I picked this game 'cause it  seemed like it might've been fun. It seemed like it would be different from most mmo's, or at least that was my impression, and I was right. Sorta. To start with, there are a reasonable number of classes to pick from. Although the brief descripions left me a little unsure as to what classes were actually effective in a fight. Although I've seen a bit of plot kicking around, I wasn't entirely sure what it was nor could I beto find out. The battles were kinda fun for the first two or three before the tedium set in. That was mainly because while there were a bunch of skills they only level up when you use them. Which meant that you'd only wind up using a couple that were strong enough to actually do anything. Even then I found that enemies I fought that were something I could techincally beat, especially in matches of 1v3 or more, I'd still have myhanded to me. So either I'm terrible at tactics in a general sense, which I can't entirely deny, or I'm just finding all of the battles meant to be fought with other people. So to put all that in one sentence, Wakfu could actually be fun later on but I'm not willing to invest the time that seems necessary to get there.

Posted: July 28, 2016
												Despite the reviews, I decided to try this game. Looks allright, music is fine, but I didn't much care for the gameplay.There are several attacks you can do, and hovering over them with the mouse shows what they do. But that's not a short line of text telling me how much damage they do, no, it's a 12 page monstrosity full of abbreviations I don't recognize with tons of numbers that mean really nothing to me. Also the numbers aren't correct, an attack that is supposed to do 6 damage just does 3, and other mistakes like that.Some items in the terrain 'guard' you, because they form a barrier between you and an enemy, which means that you can't attack because there's something in the way, but also the other way around, the tutorial tells you you're safe there yourself as well.Except that's not true. It's true that my attack can't reach the enemy, but the enemy still beats my *** up.I think the attack 'system' is way too complicated. They've tried to come up with something unique, well, it is, but not in a good way.

content:
Posted: June 11, 2015
												This game is absolutely awful. It is, without doubt, one of the worst things to ever hit the internet. I won't even go in to how ABSURDLY unintuitive it is, or how awful the entire sound scheme is. I'll just focus on this one, glaring, point that makes this game completely not worth it.There is a tutorial mission, that will two-shot you. I understand what I am supposed to do. It's teaching you about Line of Sight, and how to avoid damage. Here's the thing though, the punishment is somewhere in the area of 15 damage, when you've got about 60 HP at this point. This is horrendous. You make a few mistakes, and you're dead. And I'll be honest, that isn't even THAT awful, but the line of sight for the attacks isn't SHOW to you! You have to run a gauntlet to an enemy, and you have FOUR chances to mess up. It's trial and error at the most ABSURD level. Your reward for finally getting to the end of the gauntlet? You get to do it again, in an even LESS defined map. It's stupid. It's awful.If the tutorial was this horribly put together, then the game as a whole can't possibly be much better.Oh and the kicker, at this point, you're not even allowed to be in a party to get help from somebody. In an MMO, they don't allow you to be in a party.An MMO...where you can't party. Can I stress that enough?Save your time, avoid this awful excuse for a game.

number of helpful: 0 of 8 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 3, 2014
												Although this game has been littered with poorly written positive reviews that tell you NOTHING about this game I'm going to give you an honest review of what it's like to download this game, jump in, find your feet and then play *actual* content.First of all, the tutorial is *okay*. It definitely doesn't need to be adjusted content wise. However, this game is over filling with broken English so DO NOT EXPECT the tutorial to help you in any deep sense; you learn this game by guessing and learning from your mistakes. It is NOT an 'intuitive' game and I've met many players higher level then me who didn't know basic stradegies that I learnt early on. Many as in several. As in 7 other players who considered themselves amazing.Secondly, finding your feet is an awful experience. If you're a stranger to turn-based gameplay GIVE UP NOW. You're tossed into this enormous world filled with options but absolutely no sense of purpose or direction. To begin with, it can be SO immense that quiting IMMEDIATELY was a considered option. "Why should I even bother with all this CRAP?". You learn  your own way and you creative your own incentive, which works excellently later in the game but early game it's a miserable experience. After you find your feet and get the rythm of the game it BEGINS to become amusing enough to be considered a video game. So prepare for a pretty bitter beginning phase.Lastly, the in game content itself... So I've tried not to make the same mistake I've made on other MMOs. I've avoided the "grind my character to max and then quit" attitude and instead have be working on leveling up all my professions with my main level to make the game much more interesting. In fact, there has been some real "shining moment" inside Wakfu that no other game has come close to fulfilling. I mean there was a point where I was mining, skinning, farming and fighting all in my own little area and it was AWESOME FUN... to begin with. Now every bit of storage I have is totally and utterly filled with essential crafting resources all of which have an enormous amount of units (400+ thistle, 500 wood, etc) so dropping IS NOT AN OPTION. I tried to combat this technical issue by crafting bags but the developers seem to have not considered that new players may want to try crafting as well; only assuming that you're clearly a high leveled player with tonnes of bag space because you poked enough fat mobs to have a full set of maxed capacity bags. I needed to gather 6 Royal Feathers from a very easy and low level dungeon. I ran that dungeon over 250 times over 2 days at my maximum speed. After all of that ... 5 feathers. Oh and a quest that will take 10 off of me. So really now I need 16. I am NOT willing to be put through such a f**k around for low level content, get real you idiots. Try PLAYING YOUR GAME instead of theorizing crap that works. "Ohh 16 feathers isn't much in theory"... WRONG. Wrong. Wrong. It's TOO much and has wasted over 16 hours of my life. For the dungeons themselves, they're *okay*. You fight the same mobs you come against in the world and then eventually a boss with much more HP and stats then normal. There is very little feedback to add to such a generic system. It works fine? That's all I can say. But! If you're with a friend and your friend lags out or DC's then expect a 40 second skirmish to last longer then 15 minutes (which is bloody insane to sit through) because the game will CONSTANTLY "wait" for the player for minute intervals even if the dungeon and game itself has acknowledge the player not only leaving but being offline.Overall, you're basically fighting the game the entire way through JUST to enjoy small parts of it.Long story short: play something else because you'll quit most likely faster then I did.

Posted: May 31, 2016
												Ingredients2 large eggsSalt and pepper2 to 3 tablespoons shredded cheese (optional)1/4 to 1/2 cup filling, pre-cooked if necessary (optional)2 teaspoons unsalted butterMinced parsley, to garnish (optional)EquipmentMixing bowlWhisk8-inch nonstick skilletSpatulaDinner plateInstructions1. Whisk the eggs: Crack both eggs into a mixing bowl. Whisk the eggs until completely combined, and season with salt and pepper. If you\'re adding cheese or other fillings, make sure they are prepped and nearby.2. Warm the skillet and melt the butter: Place an 8-inch skillet over medium-high heat and melt the butter. Tilt the skillet as the butter melts to evenly coat the bottom. When the butter stops sizzling, the pan is heated and ready.3. Pour the eggs into the skillet: Pour the whisked eggs into the skillet. Immediately tilt the pan so the eggs coat the entire bottom. The eggs should sizzle on contact; if not, continue cooking, but remember to heat the pan a little longer next time.4. Drag and push the eggs to form waves: Use a spatula to gently drag and push the cooked eggs from the edges toward the center of the pan, making space for the uncooked eggs and forming waves in the omelette. Tilt the skillet so that the uncooked eggs flow into the open spaces.5. Cook the omelette for 1 to 2 minutes: The omelette will finish cooking in 1 to 2 minutes. When done, the bottom will be set and the edges will look crisp. The top of the omelette should still look fairly wet and uncooked, but there will no longer be any loose, easily flowing liquid egg  the omelette will continue cooking off the heat, so finish when you think the top still seems a bit underdone.6. Top with cheese and fillings: If using, sprinkle the cheese and fillings down the center of the omelette.7. Fold the omelette: Fold the bottom third of the omelette over the center, and then fold the top third down. Alternatively, fold the omelette in half.8. Slide the omelette onto a plate: Gently slide the omelette onto a plate and garnish with parsley. Eat right away while still hot.

content:
Posted: September 19, 2014
												I saw this game on steam and was like "Hey, the reviews don't sound too bad". And then I started it...First let me tell you, I'm not a fan of strategy RPGs, where you have to position your character and such. Maybe this clouds my judgement, maybe not.I opened the game, and had the choice to do just the tutorial after a few MB downloading (which is a pretty nice feature!). I then proceeded to wait for the game to finish loading. Since it took more than a minute, I just restarted it. And it loaded instantly. Then I had to give my acoount a name. Well, seems like "God" is forbidden in your account name. The game doesn't tell you however. It just tells you "This name is forbidden". Nothing more, nothing less. After a few tries I finally found out, that "God" isn't allowed, so I took something else. The game asks me if I want to play the tutorial. I did, and I regret it. In the tutorial you are asked to gather and plant seeds. Gathering is easy, but the planting... Imagine a field full of flowers and quite a few spots with just grass on them. You can only plant seeds on grass obviously. The game thinks so too... or not. "The area is full", "Ecosystem: bla bla, try killing some monsters" are the messages I get. Well, ok. Let's kill a monster. The game doesn't give you an option to do so though.  Tired of this, I deleted my character, so I could pick the name again. And finally could play it, after ignoring all the bugs (also ignoring the fact, that no sound played, another bug).The classes seem to be fine and fun. I have only tried one class, however. So I guess I can't really tell much about it. The GUI seems pretty nice. Big screen, almost nothing on it. I guess that's pretty good, I missed the minimap though (Dunno if you can activate it somehow). Finding out, how the "Quest Compass" works, I finished a few quests and leveled up. The game yet again tells me something "Don't forget to spend your points!", or something like that. However, this is only something you can do on level 5 and later on, because then you unlock something, where you can actually spend points on leveling up.After finally reaching level 5, I decided to stop playing. I still don't know how I level skills or how I even get them. The game doesn't tell me either.Maybe if the game fixes some of the bugs, I will give it another go. But as of now, I can't recommend it due to the bugs and the innovative GUI.

Lots of different types of enemies and interesting set of skills to use.  Im not far into the game but I found the story to be interesting, the gameplay very enjoyable and there were quite a few people playing online and of the few that I talked to they all said they love the game.  Also worth noting that I had no issues at all with performance as has been put forward by other people.  My laptop is average at best as well and no issues at all.  Not saying others are lying but just my experience was fine.  The game did take a good 10 minutes to start though on 1st launch due to updates. The game world is absolutely huge.  Loads of different islands/counties, gorgeous artwork, engaging combat system and so much replayability with 13 different classes.Now for what I wasnt so keen on.  The timer on the combat system.  I actually think its a great idea, expecially for PVP so people dont take forever but I think when you are learning the game it should be disabled.  You only get 30 seconds to make your moves and when you dont know the game or what different buffs and debuffs are in play I found myself paniking at times which doesnt suit the relaxing nature of the game.  Like I say great idea but I think it should only apply for level 10.  I then started to get confused by the crafting.  To the point that I turned it off.  So many professions and things to craft that I found it daunting.  Im not going to give up though.  The game has interested me enough to do some reading up on the subject on the forums.I think this game has potential to take over my life if I allow it. If turn based games in a fantasy MMO setting interests you then i strongly advise you to give this a go.

												A really great game that very few people have heard about. It has a unique style of combat in the MMO-verse: turn-based. The good thing is, it's pretty quick considering the turn-based nature of it. The community seems pretty good, maybe a bit on the younger side of things (majority under 25 is my guess), but that's not been a negative for me (almost 30). For those who are inclined to get deep into the game, there is a political system for each of the four nations, as well as an in-depth weather system that ties into the ecosystem for each nation.The graphics are totally awesome; it has a top-down view, similar to that of Ultima Online or Dark Ages (Nexon).It's definitely worth a go if you're looking for something free and detailed.
