number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 19, 2014
												-the time played is of course false, Id say I've spent about 150 hours in game? -********** INTRODUCTION - A BIT OF HISTORY ***********Now I was a player of Wakfu back in the day (in 2012, like everyone here) and frankly the game was good. now sure, I had to pay a monthly fee (that was not nearly as much as what WoW would ask you to pay, but still, I had to pay it), but the game itself was great. The problem was that unfortunately, the servers were devoid of players, because most wakfu players would have been Dofus players and I think that the beta of Wakfu did really badly with tons of bugs etc. So I eventually dropped the game, like GW2, if you want, and went for something else. You cannot guess how surprised I was to see this game coming on steamplay xD.Well, I for one think that this is the best thing Ankama (french gaming company who did Dofus and Wakfu) could have done. Byt doing this not only will their number of players multiply by 100 (it was that low) but the game will be revived. As I understand it, now, there is no need for monthly payment (which I find is great) and you can just enjoy a great game for free.***********     THE REVIEW AT THE STATE THE GAME WAS IN 4 MONTHS AGO    ***********                       ( not much has changed except for an extra playable character )Now I keep saying great game, but what makes this game so great? many, many things.I think the first word to describe this game would be innovative, it is struggling to do something no MMO has ever done.+ Everyone has their own player house FROM THE BEGINNING and it can be upgraded and decorated through quests, achievements and dungeon battles.+ It has a very extensive job system. (it really is, trust me, you don't?  prepare to cut wood, fish, kill monsters, create monsters, plant trees, plant herbs/pick herbs, cereals (not the same skill tree), mine, craft potions, food and drink, weapons and armor, and bags and even house decorations. Each job comes with a skill tree which when ugraded allows you to pick and plant more resources/ make better gear.+ A very advanced ecosystem if all you do is cut a certain type of tree and no one else around you is planting some, prepare to be sued by the government for being anti ecologist. I also strongly advise not to cut down endangered species as that WILL lower your citizenship rating and you will eventually become an outlaw. Your chances of succesfully planting a plant will be mitigated by the weather, some plants like it sunny, others not so much.+ And to follow up on that point, an extremely well thought out political system. There is a government for each faction (there are four) on each server, in which there is a governor, and maybe 6-7 ministers (defence, ecology, economy, war... ). The governor's job is mainly two things, to go to war and to decide whih laws are in place or not. There are maybe 30 laws that can be turned off or on and that affect the daily life of the citizenry. The political system is extremely important because the government itself will organise events, and issue the tax levels on the different areas of the game. The government can spend the money gained this way in different ways: to control the weather in some areas, to edict new laws, to organise more events...+ War can be declared between factions, following that will be a grand scale battle between the said factions to conquer islands that aren't their home ones, knowing that a conquered island comes with benefits for the controlling faction.+ A Great strategic battle system which encourages you to be more tactical and not button spam like most MMO these days. there are 15  (originally there were twelve, then there were 14, and after I stopped playing they added in another one so 15) classes, each with a different skillset and abilities.+ A great variety of monsters who are also affected by the ecosystem. You can collectfrom species and then use it to spawn new monsters into the world.Well, thats all I can think of for the good points, now to the negative points-  Back in the day, each class was nerfed or augmented every day, which made for a very hazy game experience, I do not know if they still do that however I doubt that they have yet found the perfect balance between the 14 characters (now 15) as there are always some who will outperform the rest.-  In game shop. Not much to say here, i'm just putting it here because that's basically a negative aspect of any game and yes there are some things you can get from the shop that make you more powerful, so it's NOT just cosmetic, but its really not indispensable.- Still some occasionnal bugs, but nothing major.- There is a main story, but it is completely seperated from the rest of the game for some unknown reason. I would have preferred a story implemented in the rest of the game.-/+ The lack of actual quests can be a bit annoying at first but I guess the presence of dynamic events (like in guild wars 2) makes it a bit better.Yeah so I guess that's it, I hope you read it all and that it was helpful. Of course don't try this if you hate turn based strategy, but if you don't, even if you're not sure after reading my review, just try it, it's free ;)******************** WHAT IS HAPPENING NOW ********************Unfortunately Ankama doesnt give aabout it's French player base (when we are the ones who have been supporting the game for 2 years) and does not let french accounts (like mine) play the game from Steam at all when Steam is the place to play it because of the newly found international playerbase. I think this is a stupid and  move and I am forced to thumbs down this game because of this. The game itself is still loved, but I cant thumbs up a game I can't play.***********************UPDATE AS OF 20/02 ************************Ankama FINALLY stopped their t! It took them 2 years! but now the game is finally free to play for all!! (changing my review form negative to positive as a result)  :D

content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
												Do you like Fire Emblem? Final Fantasy Tactics? Luminous Arc or any other SRPG's? Then this is the MMO for you!Unlike other SRPG's Wakfu task you with not controling a batallion of pretty simple characters, but instead a singular complex character. Your hero will have muliple attacks and buffs they will have to manage to achive peek performance.However the game will allow you to use Side kicks. These guys act as secondary party members and while not as complex ( Usually ) they still have at least three different attacks. The starter Side Kick has 3 attacks, a heavy, a light and an attack that will let it fly across the map at higher levels. It might be your starter but he'll be a strong companion till even late into the game.You can have 2 side kicks, which will allow you to easily play up till around level 100, which is half way to the level cap.All in all this is a REALLY fun game, I recomend you take a look yourself. Oh and watch the anime too it's very good.

												The best free tactical MMORPG with the best 2D MMORPG artstyle.Highly customizable characters, pretty much every piece of gear has an in-game model.It gets really mechanic-heavy as you progress through the levels, having 5 spells of 3 different elements, and a bunch of passive and active special skill as well as some class-restricted special skills, both of which can be leveled up as you desire giving you a lot of different gameplay options for each class; this becomes even more in-depth considering the game has 15 different classes.A lot of pets, mounts, companions and emotes to obtain (and buy, sadly) and a very big world with a lot of dungeons to explore.The only con for this game is the fact that there are amost no side-quests other than the mercenary works that aren't very rewarding and the drop hunting quests which are very repetitive and don't have much substance to them (this changes once you start the big quests for the main areas, but is still a big problem that wouldn't be too hard to adress), which makes the -neccesary- grinding pretty boring.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 3, 2016
												What the hell am I doing with my life?This game isn't bad, per say. It's just . . . not original.Before the fans bleed out of the ceiling tiles and throw snowballs at my face, let me explain:The "revolutionary" turn-based combat system was created LONG ago in Final Fantasy Tactics for GameBoy Advance.The "Open-World" MMORPG was done in EVERY MMORPG since UO.The only thing that is remotely unique are the characters and story lines - and those are sterotypical of the anime/manga books printed since the early 1980's.Is this the best COLLECTION of items thrown together for people to play at once? Perhaps.But it desperately needs more people playing. And by "people" I mean "real players," not kids home from elementary school killing time before dinner and common-core homework.Give it a shot, it's free; there's nothing to lose except a few brain cells and an hour or two of game time for a fun little mashed game. Play it, learn the cheesy block/turn/action style combat system, and see how things progress. Just be warned, WAFKU demands a micromanagement of damn near everything....

												Took a minute to get use to game play style.   So far it keeps me interested moving through each goal (i guess  you could call them quests).  I'm not particularly interested in the story line, but game play is fun and reminds me of a FF7 meets EverQuest.  Background sounds are overly repetitive and can get annoying.  Low game play time so far, I'll update the review after leveling up a few more times.   So far i like it, fun play and nice toon graphics, nice turn based combat outweighs any cons so far. If you enjoy MMO and clicker games, this is a fairly casual easy to play MMO clicker.. and its free at the moment!   4 out of 5 stars...  -1 only for repetitive background sounds can ruin some immersion.

												An adventure game, indeed. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 24, 2014
												Had to Edit this review due to massive changes in the game since it was written. Prior to this, it was 57 of 67 Helpful, and I recommended it.However, due to these changes, I can no longer recommend this trainwreck of a game.It seemed like they made such good decisions with the initial steam release. Class fixes/overhauls to make them useful and fun again, removal of most of the "pay to even play let alone win" mechanics.But then they redid a number of classes, again. Including my beloved Zookeeper Osa. What once was the only class I genuinely enjoyed, with a stable full of pets I could summon 3 or 4 pets at once with, has been transformed into a shadow of it's former self with only a single pet allowed, some stupid new buff/energy system, and all my previous skills (and thus my gear) being rendered mostly useless.This is on top of the LOOOOOOOOONG-awaited "Hero" system turning out to be complete Everyone was expecting this new system that let you use Alt chars on the same account as Sidekicks/Party Members, since previously, everyone had multiple accounts anyways with alts in their party - so we figured, "Cool, they're going to implement a system to make this official and easier on both us and the servers."WRONG. The Hero system is a monthly subscription, which costs more per-char you want to add, and highly overpriced. People were waiting for this to come out and be the game-saver, what made the community skyrocket, instead, people quit in droves, major cities that once had dozens or hundreds of shop bags out are now empty, and the pop has dropped outside of the French servers.They also took the main neutral gathering point, the Temple in Astrub, and literally deleted the entire area where everyone had their shop bags and socialized and had duels at, so there's no room to do anything social there anymore. The developers. actively. removed. socialization. On purpose.What was once a good, fun little game has been destroyed by terrible decisions. RIP Wakfu.

												Do you like cute art styles and are capable of over looking more then 200 hours of grinding while listening to various remixs of music no one has ever heard of while doing the same robotic task with possible glitchs and stupid mini games that actually have an effect as to have a reason for you to keep an eye on the screen at all times?. Great!. Then read on and prepare for a completly random review.The gameplay is turn based grid based game with all the stragrindy of having higher numbers then what ever misshappen remixed abomination from kinder children on acid with some slang swears and lewd sexual content only those within the teenage and dirty mind will understand type of creatures.Armed with all the spells you could want "about 15 total for each class 20 for huppermage" that allows diverse switching of tactics with a wide arsenal of elemental attacks "3 of whice you will actually use".With a job system that takes for f**king ever to amount to anything and minor cases of Ptsd Ocd and emotinal stress of watching your waifu endure endless in what ever mundane task you can think of from planting trees cutting wheat to mineing fixed placed self regenerting material blocks for ores "most of whice you will delete cause you just want to make money and its useless".With the classes being seperated into ones whice you play if you have friends and others if you don't become a one man army or a severaly crippled low level scrub that barely manages to get by in the worst and worlds most broken econamy since post obama.With all the weapon selection whice amp your abilitys you can increase even further... your abilitys! "no one actually uses weapons we just use them for stat boosts like armour, only use a weapon if you feel like wasteing time and showing off your sweet sweet swag".With the ability to grind Grind! GRIND!! you too can become a low level player still stuck around level 50 out of "200 i think" cause you have no f**king idea how to level up properly and there is no average guides worth reading after you have actually started the game and planned it all in advance.Beat up hapless monsters and make your way haphazardly through the world of... uh... grid based tile sets whice become a real pain to navigate as you will only be useing the mouse to move!, thats right DOTA fans, left click to move right for actions! "though in Dota its actually the other way around but really who cares?".Join up with a dwindling community as we try to uphold the game with all the minor and worthless value it has and is waiting for!, play for a few days, take break for a few months, repeat again and again as the replay value "nothing" becomes so boring you actually have more fun not playing the  game!.But for those who are persistant, brave, and or have no lives, come play with us, where we will completly ignore you as were to busy trying to work around the absolutely horrible player priceing commonly found in Mmo's but with less players and rarer gear worth even more!.It has some good sides but iv forgetten half of them and can't be bothered with minor details, really its a typical Mmo all things considered its small it runs well and it does have an enjoyment factor though you will find it much greater if you have some friends decide to roll play or not and actually work together, apart from that you will find yourself feeling lonely like many other Mmo's where even in the busiest market places no one actually bothers to openly sell stuff "except outside a giant church in neutral territory cause you will want to collect your token each day you log in".This in its own way could be counted as a beutiful flawed master piece, and if they fixed some $hit it would be even better and attract more players thus enchancing the game, but its made in french... france. Sacr blu its one of those two!. So good luck trying to suggest anything to the devs.Waifu. I mean Wakfu! - 6.5/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 19, 2014
												-the time played is of course false, Id say I've spent about 150 hours in game? -********** INTRODUCTION - A BIT OF HISTORY ***********Now I was a player of Wakfu back in the day (in 2012, like everyone here) and frankly the game was good. now sure, I had to pay a monthly fee (that was not nearly as much as what WoW would ask you to pay, but still, I had to pay it), but the game itself was great. The problem was that unfortunately, the servers were devoid of players, because most wakfu players would have been Dofus players and I think that the beta of Wakfu did really badly with tons of bugs etc. So I eventually dropped the game, like GW2, if you want, and went for something else. You cannot guess how surprised I was to see this game coming on steamplay xD.Well, I for one think that this is the best thing Ankama (french gaming company who did Dofus and Wakfu) could have done. Byt doing this not only will their number of players multiply by 100 (it was that low) but the game will be revived. As I understand it, now, there is no need for monthly payment (which I find is great) and you can just enjoy a great game for free.***********     THE REVIEW AT THE STATE THE GAME WAS IN 4 MONTHS AGO    ***********                       ( not much has changed except for an extra playable character )Now I keep saying great game, but what makes this game so great? many, many things.I think the first word to describe this game would be innovative, it is struggling to do something no MMO has ever done.+ Everyone has their own player house FROM THE BEGINNING and it can be upgraded and decorated through quests, achievements and dungeon battles.+ It has a very extensive job system. (it really is, trust me, you don't?  prepare to cut wood, fish, kill monsters, create monsters, plant trees, plant herbs/pick herbs, cereals (not the same skill tree), mine, craft potions, food and drink, weapons and armor, and bags and even house decorations. Each job comes with a skill tree which when ugraded allows you to pick and plant more resources/ make better gear.+ A very advanced ecosystem if all you do is cut a certain type of tree and no one else around you is planting some, prepare to be sued by the government for being anti ecologist. I also strongly advise not to cut down endangered species as that WILL lower your citizenship rating and you will eventually become an outlaw. Your chances of succesfully planting a plant will be mitigated by the weather, some plants like it sunny, others not so much.+ And to follow up on that point, an extremely well thought out political system. There is a government for each faction (there are four) on each server, in which there is a governor, and maybe 6-7 ministers (defence, ecology, economy, war... ). The governor's job is mainly two things, to go to war and to decide whih laws are in place or not. There are maybe 30 laws that can be turned off or on and that affect the daily life of the citizenry. The political system is extremely important because the government itself will organise events, and issue the tax levels on the different areas of the game. The government can spend the money gained this way in different ways: to control the weather in some areas, to edict new laws, to organise more events...+ War can be declared between factions, following that will be a grand scale battle between the said factions to conquer islands that aren't their home ones, knowing that a conquered island comes with benefits for the controlling faction.+ A Great strategic battle system which encourages you to be more tactical and not button spam like most MMO these days. there are 15  (originally there were twelve, then there were 14, and after I stopped playing they added in another one so 15) classes, each with a different skillset and abilities.+ A great variety of monsters who are also affected by the ecosystem. You can collectfrom species and then use it to spawn new monsters into the world.Well, thats all I can think of for the good points, now to the negative points-  Back in the day, each class was nerfed or augmented every day, which made for a very hazy game experience, I do not know if they still do that however I doubt that they have yet found the perfect balance between the 14 characters (now 15) as there are always some who will outperform the rest.-  In game shop. Not much to say here, i'm just putting it here because that's basically a negative aspect of any game and yes there are some things you can get from the shop that make you more powerful, so it's NOT just cosmetic, but its really not indispensable.- Still some occasionnal bugs, but nothing major.- There is a main story, but it is completely seperated from the rest of the game for some unknown reason. I would have preferred a story implemented in the rest of the game.-/+ The lack of actual quests can be a bit annoying at first but I guess the presence of dynamic events (like in guild wars 2) makes it a bit better.Yeah so I guess that's it, I hope you read it all and that it was helpful. Of course don't try this if you hate turn based strategy, but if you don't, even if you're not sure after reading my review, just try it, it's free ;)******************** WHAT IS HAPPENING NOW ********************Unfortunately Ankama doesnt give aabout it's French player base (when we are the ones who have been supporting the game for 2 years) and does not let french accounts (like mine) play the game from Steam at all when Steam is the place to play it because of the newly found international playerbase. I think this is a stupid and  move and I am forced to thumbs down this game because of this. The game itself is still loved, but I cant thumbs up a game I can't play.***********************UPDATE AS OF 20/02 ************************Ankama FINALLY stopped their t! It took them 2 years! but now the game is finally free to play for all!! (changing my review form negative to positive as a result)  :D

												I am playing Dofus (The best game of Ankama *for me* and the game that tells the beggining of the story of twelve gods and things like that.  recommend that game too but it's p2p) since 2009. Things have changed since then. But i remember how i was excited for a new releasing game named "Wakfu". I was watching the videos of Wakfu all day and nights. At first when i downloaded it, i didn't like it. Because it wasn't like Dofus. It had lots of different things. But i started to understand things in the game. t had a new skills system (and i liked it most). Whatever, i recommend this game because i have a reasonless love for ankama games and i think these games are the best MMORPG ever. You can do anything you want, choose a profession, join a guild, fight against monsters (most of them are not like monsters) or players, improve your character the way you want and reach the 200. level. (And if you be able to do that don't think game is finished. The game's real fun is starting at 200. level)

content:
Posted: February 23, 2016
												Wakfu is not a game; its a lifestyle.  where your actions effect the whole of a mmo world. there is many things you can do, from crafting or performing a profession such as armorer, or farming. or defeating dungeons useing a tactical rpg format. after 2 overhauls of the way skills work and how stats are effected, the game is more balanced.  in addition to skills making more sence, and easy to upgrade them from lvling. i like the feature of the haven bag/world. haveing your own extra storage that you can carry along with you; customize with bedroom sets, garden gems(for growing stuff), and crafting tables-so you can do professions or craft on the go/collect and save plants for later use. what i dont like is that the official site gives more buyable options-even though donation rewards overall dont overpower your progression over others in any big or lasting way. i would like the option to change my name or get any of the other things steam wakfu shop doesnt have that official site shop does.       but after going over merit and flaw balance, then compared to other games of style type or what is available during this era of gaming, i give it a 8/10.  and definately recommend other to pick it up and play it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 29, 2016
												This is a good game.Where to start. First of all,wakfu is a multi media idea. There are shows,comics,and the game. Of course,this is gonna be about the game.The creators appear to have worked their best to keep the game from a p2w platform,as all the thingd you can buy in the shop are either cosmetic or has severe downsides to it,such as the garden haven gem. Gardening in the world gives you experience toward Farming or Lumberjack,depending on if you're tending to trees or crops,but planting things in your haven bag grants no xp to the skills. All of the armor in the shop is also cosmetic,and everything has to be earned,whether you like it or not. The closest thing to a p2w is subscriber status,which grants you bonus items after a fight and more XP after a fight,along with a potion that makes crafting easier. In short,wakfu is a game where you CAN buy things with real money,but they are only minor things that make things more convenient while also introducing a downside to those conveniences. A good amount of store items can also be earned,such as a garden haven gem being able to be gotten by praying at the Almanax Altar for 60 days in a row,or completing certain dungeins.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 19, 2016
												I've played Dofus years ago and enjoyed every minute of it. I can say the same about Wakfu. There's a lot of freedom, fun and enjoyable content in this game. Turn based combat forces you to think alot about your moves and lets you plan your movement in the future turns. The world is huge and well done. Another feature that should be noticed is that there's no NPC shops. There's an auction house, where people create economy and dictate prices. I also enjoy profession and crafting system. I find leveling up my crafting/harvesting skills very enjoyable. All in all, I could talk a lot about this game, but you should try it for yourselves. After all, it's free to play.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 24, 2014
												Had to Edit this review due to massive changes in the game since it was written. Prior to this, it was 57 of 67 Helpful, and I recommended it.However, due to these changes, I can no longer recommend this trainwreck of a game.It seemed like they made such good decisions with the initial steam release. Class fixes/overhauls to make them useful and fun again, removal of most of the "pay to even play let alone win" mechanics.But then they redid a number of classes, again. Including my beloved Zookeeper Osa. What once was the only class I genuinely enjoyed, with a stable full of pets I could summon 3 or 4 pets at once with, has been transformed into a shadow of it's former self with only a single pet allowed, some stupid new buff/energy system, and all my previous skills (and thus my gear) being rendered mostly useless.This is on top of the LOOOOOOOOONG-awaited "Hero" system turning out to be complete Everyone was expecting this new system that let you use Alt chars on the same account as Sidekicks/Party Members, since previously, everyone had multiple accounts anyways with alts in their party - so we figured, "Cool, they're going to implement a system to make this official and easier on both us and the servers."WRONG. The Hero system is a monthly subscription, which costs more per-char you want to add, and highly overpriced. People were waiting for this to come out and be the game-saver, what made the community skyrocket, instead, people quit in droves, major cities that once had dozens or hundreds of shop bags out are now empty, and the pop has dropped outside of the French servers.They also took the main neutral gathering point, the Temple in Astrub, and literally deleted the entire area where everyone had their shop bags and socialized and had duels at, so there's no room to do anything social there anymore. The developers. actively. removed. socialization. On purpose.What was once a good, fun little game has been destroyed by terrible decisions. RIP Wakfu.

content:
Posted: August 31, 2015
												First of all most games that you can play these days are easy mode meaning it doesn't take much to get to the end game.  Most F2P games ask you to spend everything you have to get ahead, including the shirt on your back. This game isn't either. It takes a lot of effort to level up and everyone is equal (not P2W). Ya sure there are perks to this game when you buy booster packs but it's not a lot in the way that it would put you at a higher class than others so you can be OP. It's well balanced with good graphics and music. It even has some humor in it to make you laugh. So if you want a game to take your mind off things (spend hours out of reality and beat things up to exact your fustration), need a good laugh, see graphics that are pleasing to the eye, and maybe even feel like dancing to good tunes then this game is for YOU! It's a well balanced turn based game so some may not like it but for those who like or even love turn based games then give this a try. What will it hurt?? :-)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												--Edit--As of the update to 1.43 myself as well as several other people I've talked to in-game have not been able to purchase the in-game currency for their shop (Ogrines). I attempted to report the issue to Ankama support but they were rude and dismissive, sending me to Steam support saying my account was being restricted per the "Trading and Market Restrictions" (found at https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=1047-EDFM-2932 ).I forwarded them a screenshot of my purchase history and explained how this policy did not affect me based on my purchase history. They responded with this:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Please accept our sincerest apologies.However, we have already endorsed this case to a higher level of customer support. Unfortunately, they have made their decision and have stated it as final. Therefore, we are unable to reverse it or force a different outcome. We understand that decision is not according to your expectations.As per our previous message, we are unfortunately not able to provide you more assistance on this issue.For a breakdown of the new purchase restrictions enforced by Steam, they are as follows:+Steam accounts are not allowed any purchase unless they had a successful purchase older than 30 days but not older than 1 year.+The successful purchase (meaning the transaction was not cancelled or refunded) of wallet funds, games, DLCs and software meet this requirement.+Retail CD key activations and gift purchases do not meet this requirement and will not lift the purchase restrictions on a Steam account.Please opt to contact the Steam Customer Support for further assistance. Apologies for the inconvenience.Kind regards,------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------I will update this review whenever I get the problem solved, but as for now I am at my wits end. I cannot recommend the game until they show better commitment to solving (at least) paying customer's issues in a timely manner.--Edit End--I love this game. It's artwork is amazing, It has an almost entirely player driven world from the ecosystem to nations ruled by PCs. Wars are fought as much through ecoterrorism as face to face combat. There are a multitude of guilds which fill in gameplay between storyline quests (if the national dramas aren't enough!) The system can be a bit buggy as stated in previous reviews but no-where near the point where the game loses playability. It is turn-based but there is also a turn timer which keeps things moving fairly well. The classes don't quite use traditional roles (tank, dps, healer, ect.) per say. In many cases you CAN build your character to strictly fill one of these roles and you'll find tons of guides on the Ankama forums to help you do so. That being said, MOST classes you can build to fill one or two roles successfully or a well rounded solo character that has just as good playability and balance in a group filling a role.The game is great, it gets monthly updates, it blends with an anime that even further immerses you into the World of Twelve. And it's highly addictive. 10/10 all around. Give it a shot and you'll be hooked!

												..it's a fun game.. if you like to play farm.v, you can farm here.if you like playing city.v, you can build your city inside a Haven World or decorate your haven bag.if you like adventure, there are quests and story-line for you.if you like to just socialize and get new friends, u can chat and do interactive action with the avatar.if you enjoy pvp, there are pvp sites especially for pvp fans.if you love to run dungeons, wakfu has a lot of dungeons to run. the only thing you need is to find a group. or run the dungeons solo with the accompany of sidekicks.if you like to feel accomplishing something, wakfu has a long list of achivement you can try to complete.There are a lot of stuff to do in wakfu, as it is a player driven economy.Join an active guild. aside from getting bonuses and better chance to get parties, Guilds also organize Events for their members. You can get goodies and cool stuff.Some of the players practically 'living' in wakfu.I spent hours playing it daily.try it and decide if it's for you.If u decide you wanna try this game... Come to Phaeris server! best for GMT+8. Asia. Most of us would be online during the evening so if u're from that other part of the world you probably see us mostly in the morning. Dont worry we are international players with English speaking community. and the community consist of all players around the globe.Phaeris server is the friendliest community in Wakfu and we welcome newbies.Market price for most items in Phaeris is a lot cheaper too. Even the Haven World is cheap.Come join us.. we have cookies! :D

content:
Posted: September 18, 2016
												Disregard my playtime on steam. I play without the Steam launcher. Alright, you already know this game is good just from other reviews alone, so i'll introduce you toWakfu's unique classes, with more coming soon.  Sacrier- Get this: FIGHT WITH YOUR ING BLOOD! Shoot blood, whip at your foes with blood, HOW METAL IS THAT? Oh. Did i mention, the lower your ing health, THE STRONGER YOU ING GET! AAAAAARGHHHHH Xelor- It's Rolex spelt backwards. Control time, my boi. rewind your actions and make like 12039012 moves each turn while your enemies get blown the  up. Sram- Become invisible, Clone yourself, Stab enemies in the back - all at the same time. Sadida- Curse your enemies with your dolls and wreck anything that tries to toch you. Turn into a ing tree when things get tough. Be Bastion from Overwatch, but this time in Wakfu. Rogue- Shoot bullets at enemies, run away, and blow up that bomb you set up ahead of time. ALL ACCORDING TO KEIKAKU DESUIop- Basic, easy-to-learn warrior character for beginners. Cra- The Archer class. Except it isn't you usual korean-mmo acrobatic sex-appeal elf archer. The Cra can set up Beacons around the map to shoot at, which then lead into devastating effects.  Pandawa- Drunken Kung Fu plus Disgaea throwing mechanics. Throw booze (or milk) at your foes, and light them up! Holy Eniripsa- WORDS THAT KILLLL- no, heal. Yes, use words to apply support effects on your team, and also mark out enemies to weaken and defeat! Osamodas- Summoner Class. Not your run-of-the mill kind. Whip away at your enemies, and befriend + capture almost any enemy in the game to fight for you! Iyou not. Masqueraiders- Switch between a great number of Masks while in combat to change between different abilites. Think Kamen Rider, but even more anime now. Huppermages- Use every element possible to blow everything up. Foggernaut- Play as a steampunk robot, and have a skill called "Hammer Time".  Feca- Tank class. Set up runes to cockblock enemies and become ING INVINCIBLE Enutrof- Everybody wants you in their party. You can deal damage, summon, heal, cook, swim, make breakfast, cook, deal damage, cook. Ecaflip- This class actually has Slot Machine Sound Effects. This class plays like a slot machine. 'nuff said.  Eliotrope- THE MOST ING FUN. Make portals, walk through portals, make portals through portals, and SHOOT SPELLS THROUGH PORTALS! Nothing is too far for this class. Did i mention your allies can use these too?

content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												this game!!i am a final fantasy lover! i played all of them! (just to clear my point of view here)this game, it has lots of classes, with lots of differences!it has a class which lets you capture monsters to fight for you!!! (total win for me)you can just grind on monsters if you arent much into quests, you can level really well on those!so far, every single monster you fight, gives you its own equipment set o.o xD (sounds a bit like monster hunter? RIGHT!)kill a sheep! get a sheep equipment set, kill a pink bird, get a pink feather like set!i really love that ideayou can craft a LOT, you can run around, plant trees and flowers, sure other players will just take those trees or flowers away from the ground, but you can just replant them again if you got enough seedstry to make it YOUR world with YOUR pretty or ugly flowers! maybe the others wont be high enough gardener level to destroy your beautiful landscape idea XDwell okay, its mainly just ingredients for craftingif im not in the mood to fight monsters etc, ill just run around, take seeds from flowers and plant them all over the world to get my gardener level higher :Dbtw, you can even get .... ugh... monster seeds (i know, it does sound weird saying it that way)you can plant those seeds into the ground to grow your own monsters!but i think it only works in areas where those monsters actually are, you cant grow lv 20 monsters in the lv1 area (sad xD)IF you are a solo player and HATE teaming up with others like i do, you can just be weird, pay a bit of money in the cashop and be allowed to use 2 others of YOUR characters for your team, that way you have a 3 player team which you alone control, yes, you heard right, you can make up a team by yourself ;) perfect for anti-social people like me xD(it doesnt stay forever tho, its like 2 euro per week, cheaper if you buy it for longer, but i guess you know how that works)CON!1. the monster you capture, does NOT level up with you, it stays at the level where you capture it, which means, you wont be able to keep your favorite pet till high level because it will be really really weak then.... (really sad...)2. you cant keep your favorite look in the game because the set items get weak, there is no way to preserve the look of an item (as most other mmo's do) so you end up looking really ugly in the end because of 'high-stat-item-ugly-look' stuff

Great!. Then read on and prepare for a completly random review.The gameplay is turn based grid based game with all the stragrindy of having higher numbers then what ever misshappen remixed abomination from kinder children on acid with some slang swears and lewd sexual content only those within the teenage and dirty mind will understand type of creatures.Armed with all the spells you could want "about 15 total for each class 20 for huppermage" that allows diverse switching of tactics with a wide arsenal of elemental attacks "3 of whice you will actually use".With a job system that takes for f**king ever to amount to anything and minor cases of Ptsd Ocd and emotinal stress of watching your waifu endure endless in what ever mundane task you can think of from planting trees cutting wheat to mineing fixed placed self regenerting material blocks for ores "most of whice you will delete cause you just want to make money and its useless".With the classes being seperated into ones whice you play if you have friends and others if you don't become a one man army or a severaly crippled low level scrub that barely manages to get by in the worst and worlds most broken econamy since post obama.With all the weapon selection whice amp your abilitys you can increase even further... your abilitys! "no one actually uses weapons we just use them for stat boosts like armour, only use a weapon if you feel like wasteing time and showing off your sweet sweet swag".With the ability to grind Grind! GRIND!! you too can become a low level player still stuck around level 50 out of "200 i think" cause you have no f**king idea how to level up properly and there is no average guides worth reading after you have actually started the game and planned it all in advance.Beat up hapless monsters and make your way haphazardly through the world of... uh... grid based tile sets whice become a real pain to navigate as you will only be useing the mouse to move!, thats right DOTA fans, left click to move right for actions! "though in Dota its actually the other way around but really who cares?".Join up with a dwindling community as we try to uphold the game with all the minor and worthless value it has and is waiting for!, play for a few days, take break for a few months, repeat again and again as the replay value "nothing" becomes so boring you actually have more fun not playing the  game!.But for those who are persistant, brave, and or have no lives, come play with us, where we will completly ignore you as were to busy trying to work around the absolutely horrible player priceing commonly found in Mmo's but with less players and rarer gear worth even more!.It has some good sides but iv forgetten half of them and can't be bothered with minor details, really its a typical Mmo all things considered its small it runs well and it does have an enjoyment factor though you will find it much greater if you have some friends decide to roll play or not and actually work together, apart from that you will find yourself feeling lonely like many other Mmo's where even in the busiest market places no one actually bothers to openly sell stuff "except outside a giant church in neutral territory cause you will want to collect your token each day you log in".This in its own way could be counted as a beutiful flawed master piece, and if they fixed some $hit it would be even better and attract more players thus enchancing the game, but its made in french... france. Sacr blu its one of those two!. So good luck trying to suggest anything to the devs.Waifu. I mean Wakfu! - 6.5/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 26, 2016
												This game has it's ups and downs; there are currently no Steam Achievements for it {Despite the list saying there are}; because the launcher the game uses to keep itself updated does not interweave well with the game. That said, the game is quite fun. It's similar to how the old Final Fantasy Tactics was played due to it's gridline map per battle {the grids size and obstacles change per fight} and it is an increasingly difficult grind to the next dungeon. But it pays off, because now there is an adjustable level system in place to play with friends. You can lower your level temporarily and just help your friends level or go back to your normal level and powercreep them. Players also heavily influence the enviroment which mean that certain things can change; being completely different from when you log off. To top it off, the entire game is FREE! The cash shop and membership for additional bonuses are the only things you can pay for. Don't forget to watch Wakfu the anime on Netflix. You'll see many characters from in-game there!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 6
												Warning: This review has nothing to do with the history of the game's development or the decisions of the community/developers. It's an as-is opinion brought about by playing it for 20 something hours. The game in of itself is... interesting. Unique even. The art style is arresting, the combat intriguing, and there is a class/class build for just about every play style. However, there are several unique aspects to the game that will probably put off traditional gamers.First off, the economy within the game is entirely Player driven - you literally have to go out and make the money yourself from ores or from selling goods to people who went out did this themselves. Sometimes monster or a quest might drop some, but nothing routine enough to make the effort worthwhile. There are no NPC shops to buy or sell goods from, there is just an auction house like structure and tons of player run haven shops dotting the streets in the form of bags. Professions seem critical because of this, but judging how much something is worth is up to the player. Expect to slap your forehead for underselling things from time to time. Because of the lack of selling, space in the inventory and in the player storage is at an insane premium - you're going to be juggling gear sets a bit in the beginning to try to squeeze out the AP for battles. This promotes simply destroying stacks of items outright or, if you have space, grinding them into rune dust.This economy leads into the second put off - this game, without a doubt, is a grinding player's wet dream. Battling and grinding are the two primary activities the player partakes in, so it's a darn good thing the player can pick and choose their battles in the overworld. That's right, monsters will lounge about, look cute, or in the case of the male and female sheep monsters, bounce around doing questionable things. That is, until you or another player right clicks on them and initiates the battle. This can be good or bad depending on how you want to look at it, but this does, for the most part, facilitate free exploration. Dungeons, on the other hand, force you to fight through the room's contents before you can proceed. Dungeons are highly deceptive in the fact players can mostly breeze through everything right up until the boss monsters.Speaking of battles, the battle system is simplistically complex. At it's core, it's simply moving your character (and NPC friends if you have any) around the grid battlegorund and using skills on things. The complex part is knowing how to strategically place your character to best use the skills available to your class. The lovely part is you can participate in these battles with friends. In fact, you're really best off bringing friends to this game to begin with. What will become fun/frustrating is the 30 seconds you have to perform your round in combat. This will require some practice if your class requires some setup in your initial turn, but for the most part, 30 seconds does offer a challenge and keeps things flowing.The last put off is research is definitely required. The why lies in the history of the game - some classes were buffed or debuffed according to developer whim. As I was duly inform by a friend who played for a while, in early game this matters little, but if you persist into late game, it can become a source of frustration and irritation.Yes, there are professions in the game and executing them can be a source of irritation and fun - especially when you've joined a Nation (faction) to continue on into the upper levels of the game. I'll leave the fun of this for people to discover because if you've managed to stomach the gross amount of grinding required to equip yourself well in the beginning AND get to level 30+, you're probably going to stay for a good ways in.Would I recommend this game? I certainly recommend giving it a try. The experience of playing it is unique. I won't lie - the battle system, once you're used to it, is fun - assuming you've selected a class you can enjoy (don't worry, you can make up to five characters and delete them at will). However, I do not believe it is a game for the casual player as it requires a lot of time and effort to figure out how to play your class well and grind up the levels and equipment. Equally, it's easy to miss out on a lot of content just by not knowing about it. And there is a huge potential to burn out of 'same thing, different day' like every game has issues with.Ah, and a bit of parting advise: remember to click on the dragoturkey transportation carts when you find them to unlock their usage. Otherwise you'll have to do a lot of running around.
